title: Police investigate after 17-year-old shot in north Tulsa
content:
Police are investigating after a 17-year-old male reported he was shot while driving in north Tulsa Monday night.
About 5:10 p.m. Tulsa police received a call about a shooting from the victim who reported he was shot while driving his car on Martin Luther King Jr. Boulevard between 36th Street North and Apache Street, said Tulsa Police Cpl. Jack Ritter.
The victim said a silver Chevy Impala pulled up alongside his vehicle and fired shots at him, one of which hit him in the back shoulder area, Ritter said.
After being shot, the victim drove to his girlfriend's house in the 500 block of East Reading Street to call police.
When officers arrived, EMSA was treating his bullet wound. He was transported with non-life-threatening injuries to the St. John Medical Center, Ritter said.
The victim and his girlfriend provided only sparse details, so investigators aren't sure whether this was a targeted attack, Ritter said.
